books.title: Don Quixote
books.author: Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra
books.summary: A mad knight-errant and his down-to-earth squire encounter adventure in the Spanish countryside.

books.title: A High Wind in Jamaica
books.author: Richard Hughes
books.summary: After their parents’ plantation in Jamaica is destroyed by a hurricane, a group of children returning to England are kidnapped by pirates.

books.title: Pointed Roofs
books.author: Dorothy M. Richardson
books.summary: Seventeen-year-old Miriam Henderson is sent to Germany to teach English at a finishing school in Hanover.

books.title: A General History of the Pirates
books.author: Captain Charles Johnson
books.summary: The lives and stories of the daring pirate outlaws who terrorized the Atlantic Ocean and Caribbean Sea in the 18th century.

books.title: The House of Arden
books.author: E. Nesbit
books.summary: Two children, with the aid of a magical white mole, travel into the past in search of their family’s long-lost treasure.

books.title: Uneasy Money
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: When Lord Dawlish unexpectedly comes into an inheritance, he travels from London to New York to try to give it away.

books.title: Henry VIII
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: King Henry VIII plans to divorce his first wife for Anne Bullen.

books.title: Through the Looking-Glass
books.author: Lewis Carroll
books.summary: In a follow-up to her adventures in Wonderland, Alice finds herself in a mirror image of the whimsical land where she becomes a queen in her own right.

books.title: Magnificent Obsession
books.author: Lloyd C. Douglas
books.summary: A brain surgeon’s secret obsession is discovered and adopted by the wealthy young man involved in his death.

books.title: At the Mountains of Madness
books.author: H. P. Lovecraft
books.summary: An Antarctic expedition reveals the horrifying reality of ancient myths in the depths of the continent.

books.title: A Negro Explorer at the North Pole
books.author: Matthew Henson
books.summary: The self-told story of the black man who accompanied Robert Peary during the first trip to the North Pole.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Edgar Allan Poe
books.summary: A collection of Edgar Allan Poe’s short fiction, ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Voyage of the Beagle
books.author: Charles Darwin
books.summary: Darwin’s personal account of his 1831 voyage around the world investigating the geology, botany, and zoology of various lands.

books.title: Orthodoxy
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: G. K. Chesterton’s unique view on Christianity and how all his “solitary and sincere speculations” were ultimately answered by its theology.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: James Weldon Johnson
books.summary: A collection of poems by James Weldon Johnson.

books.title: Sartor Resartus
books.author: Thomas Carlyle
books.summary: The meta-fictional commentary on the life of “famous” German philosopher Diogenes Teufelsdröckh and his Philosophy of Clothes.

books.title: First Lensman
books.author: E. E. Smith
books.summary: Virgil Samms, the first individual to receive a Lens from the mysterious and powerful Arisians, works to create the Galatic Patrol to protect all adherents of Civilization from the threat of the Boskonians and their masters, the Eddorians.

books.title: Golf Stories
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: A collection of Wodehouse’s golf stories featuring the Oldest Member.

books.title: A Day at a Time
books.author: Archibald Alexander
books.summary: A 1916 Christian devotional reflecting on faith and morality during World War I.

books.title: The Worst Journey in the World
books.author: Apsley Cherry-Garrard
books.summary: The travelogue of a member of Robert Scott’s ill-fated Antarctic expedition of 1910.
